intro: Boehmeria caudata var. ourantha, commonly known as the silky fiber plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its soft, silky fibers that are harvested from its stems. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are elongated, with a distinctive silvery underside, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers. The fibers of this plant have been traditionally used for making textiles and paper due to their fine texture and strength.
